articles.description: Melting polar ice due to climate change is redistributing Earth's mass, slowing its rotation and slightly extending the day, as highlighted by ETH Zurich's studies supported by NASA. This indicates a greater human influence on Earth’s rotational dynamics than…
articles.content: Climate change is causing Greenland and Antarctic ice to melt, shifting water to the equatorial regions and affecting Earth’s rotation, which lengthens days by a few milliseconds. Supported by NASA, … [+6877 chars]

articles.title: NASA scientists utilize AI for red planet rock analysis - Telangana Today
articles.description: For nearly three years, the Rover Mission has employed AI to autonomously identify minerals within Martian rocks. This marks the first instance of using this technology on Mars to make real-time decisions about rock composition.
